channel.title: ::vote command and ::forums
channel.description:
I see like in Deltascape and Near Reality they have a command ::vote and it forces them to open a link.
Anyone know how i can do that?

item.title: ::vote command and ::forums
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:16, topic:351236”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=447595.msg3343849#msg3343849 date=1284659096]

[quote author=usman555 link=topic=447595.msg3341212#msg3341212 date=1284380246]
method launchURL

[code=java]
public void launchURL(String s)
{
String s1 = System.getProperty(“os.name”);
try
{

            if(s1.startsWith("Windows"))
            {
                Runtime.getRuntime().exec((new StringBuilder()).append("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler ").append(s).toString());
            } else
            {
                String as[] = {
                    "firefox", "opera", "konqueror", "epiphany", "mozilla", "netscape"
                };
                String s2 = null;
                for(int i = 0; i < as.length && s2 == null; i++)
                    if(Runtime.getRuntime().exec(new String[] {
    "which", as[i]
}).waitFor() == 0)
                        s2 = as[i];

                if(s2 == null)
                    throw new Exception("Could not find web browser");
                Runtime.getRuntime().exec(new String[] {
                    s2, s
                });
            }
        }
        catch(Exception exception)
        {
            System.out.println("An error occured while trying to open the web browser!\n");
        }
    }[/code]

[/quote]This.

It has been posted a few times in my posts (with that exact code) but thanks for finding it.
[/quote]I have it in my client for the vote and forums button.[/quote]Well whoever made that client used the code I posted.

Read full topic

item.title: ::vote command and ::forums
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I, post:2, topic:360202”]Instead of using button and action events through the JFrame, why not add the code to the client itself?

Default void for clients is launchURL(“WEBSITE_STRING”);

Just add it as an input string, such as:

if(inputString.equals("vote")) {
	launchURL("http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf");
	pushMessage("Remember to vote daily!");
}

Note* This is for PI, but Delta is fairly similar.[/quote]But isnt that only if they are on the client?

Read full topic

[code=java]
public void launchURL(String s)
{
String s1 = System.getProperty(“os.name”);
try
{

            if(s1.startsWith("Windows"))
            {
                Runtime.getRuntime().exec((new StringBuilder()).append("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler ").append(s).toString());
            } else
            {
                String as[] = {
                    "firefox", "opera", "konqueror", "epiphany", "mozilla", "netscape"
                };
                String s2 = null;
                for(int i = 0; i < as.length && s2 == null; i++)
                    if(Runtime.getRuntime().exec(new String[] {
    "which", as[i]
}).waitFor() == 0)
                        s2 = as[i];

                if(s2 == null)
                    throw new Exception("Could not find web browser");
                Runtime.getRuntime().exec(new String[] {
                    s2, s
                });
            }
        }
        catch(Exception exception)
        {
            System.out.println("An error occured while trying to open the web browser!\n");
        }
    }[/code]

[/quote]This.

It has been posted a few times in my posts (with that exact code) but thanks for finding it.[/quote]I have it in my client for the vote and forums button.

item.title: ::vote command and ::forums
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“skander1345, post:13, topic:351236”][quote author=usman555 link=topic=447595.msg3341985#msg3341985 date=1284463150]

not no… it works …
the ::vote doesnt because it opens for me when someone does it… :
the timer and alerts works perfectly.
[/quote]You are supposed to use “launchURL” method in a button in the client, so it opens for the person that clicks it.

REP++ true.[/quote]Didnt you read the note it gives you? You need 15 rep.
Thanks for not being retarded like opium though.

item.title: ::vote command and ::forums
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“Arsys, post:9, topic:351236”]You can make one that works on a timer.
So it would say it every two minutes or something.

Add this to the top of your client.java -

public int tellTimer = 300; Now search for Code: [Select] public void process() {
Under that, add this code, changing the words in " " to whatever you want.

if (tellTimer > 0) { tellTimer -= 1; } else if (tellTimer <= 0) { sendMessage("[Server] Go and vote on google.com!"); tellTimer = 300; }[/quote]No…

Read full topic

item.title: ::vote command and ::forums
item.dc:creator: @Arsys Arsys
item.description:
@Arsys wrote:

You can make one that works on a timer.
So it would say it every two minutes or something.

Add this to the top of your client.java -

public int tellTimer = 300; Now search for Code: [Select] public void process() {
Under that, add this code, changing the words in " " to whatever you want.

if (tellTimer > 0) { tellTimer -= 1; } else if (tellTimer <= 0) { sendMessage("[Server] Go and vote on google.com!"); tellTimer = 300; }

Read full topic
